page.title: 05FARMING
page.content:
{ (Week of 29 June, 1985)
Recorded telephone message to farmers and growers, given by the East of Scotland College of Agriculture. { SPRING BARLEY}- spray for mildew.Now too late for herbicides, although Roundup can be used later if barley is for malting. { WINTER BARLEY}-Now too late for spraying . { WHEAT}- This may be turning yellow because of spray damage or showery weather.Still not too late to give a nitrogen spray. { OILSEED RAPE}-Test soil now for club root. Samples must be 2kg weight from 60 locations, 12cm deep. Clean grain stores now in anticipation of harvest. A blight warning for potato growers is given.
